message.content:
John McAfee was a British-American computer programmer and businessman who is best known as the founder of the software security company, McAfee Associates. He developed one of the first anti-virus programs and helped to shape cybersecurity practices in the early days of personal computing.

Born on September 18, 1945, in Cinderford, England, John moved with his family to Virginia at an early age. He graduated from Roanoke College with a degree in mathematics before pursuing various jobs related to programming and technology.

In 1987, he founded McAfee Associates with a focus on developing antivirus software for computers. His software became widely popular among clients such as IBM due to its ability to combat new virus threats daily quickly.

As his success grew along with his eccentric public persona attracts significant media attention and raises many controversies which include legal trouble involving drug possession charges and alleged involvement in a murder case while living Belize.

In later years, John became involved in various business ventures ranging from cryptocurrency projects such as Bitcoin mining operations or creating digital wallet apps but mostly ends up either
